Title: Percy Jackson And The Titans Curse
Author: রিক রাইওর্ডান
Summary:
Summary of the Book

Percy Jackson, Annabeth Chase and Thalia Grace barely escape an attack by the manticore Dr. Thorn with the help of Goddess Artemis and her hunters. However, Annabeth is captured by Dr. Thorn. The need of the hour is to find the Goddess Artemis who is the only one who can track an extremely powerful ancient monster which has arisen. With his friends and the hunters of Artemis Percy sets out on a search for both Annabeth and the Goddess. Along the way they must also face their most dangerous challenge: the Titan's curse. 

About the Author

Rick Riordan is an American author who is best known for the Percy Jackson and the Olympian Series. He graduated from Alamo Heights High School. He was featured as a guest in the San Diego Comic-Con International Fest 2010.
Book_Title: Percy Jackson And The Titans Curse

Title: Artemis fowl:The arctic incident
Author: ওয়েন কোলফার
Summary:
Summary of the Book

Artemis Fowl is currently attending boarding school at Ireland. He receives an email from his father who has been kidnapped by the Russian Mafia. Artemis runs to his father’s rescue, only to be thwarted by Captain Holly Short of the LEPrecon Fairy Police. However, this time, Artemis is going to have to work with them instead of against them to save those he loves.

About Eoin Colfer

Eoin Colfer is an Irish writer known for his Artemis Fowl series of fantasy novels. He has also written the sixth installment of the Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy series, And Another Thing ...

Title: Artemis fowl  The lost colony
Author: ওয়েন কোলফার
Summary:
Summary Of The Book

Artemis Fowl And The Lost Colony New Ed Edition continues to narrate the adventures of Artemis Fowl, who was once a teenage criminal mastermind. The series recounts how humans and fairies were involved in a great battle hundred centuries ago. When the fairies comprehended that their struggle against humans was pointless, they withdrew to the underground. But demons, who also battled against humans, stayed behind and attempted to reorganize an attack against the humans. Their attempt is foiled and the demons ended up in Limbo, getting stewed for the last ten thousand years. However, the spell holding them down is weakening and the world is at the verge of a grand demonic invasion. It again befalls Artemis Fowl and his pal, Captain Holly Short, to save their people.

The book begins with Artemis Fowl II and his bodyguard, Butler, waiting for a demon in Barcelona, Spain. Artemis predicts a demon appearance at Massimo Bellini Opera House and Artemis, Butler, and Holly go there. Here, the trio again spots the pretty, blond girl that they bumped into in Barcelona.

Artemis later finds out that the girl is his rival, a twelve-year old French prodigy who identifies herself as Minerva Paradizo. As Artemis predicts, a confused demon called No1 appears at the theatre and he is immediately captured by Minerva and her henchmen. No1 then reveals everything about demonic customs to Minerva and a sequence of events follow which involves Minerva being held hostage by the demons and Artemis rescuing her and managing to save the world. In Artemis Fowl And The Lost Colony New Edition, Artemis faces not only a race against time but also an insatiable, demon warlord. Besides this, he also has to combat a rival who happens to be very pretty.

The book has been written to evoke laughter in the bleakest situations. Colfer has used the combination of mythology and modern equipment to create a world of fantasy and has added suspense, romance, and sentiment to produce a masterwork.

About Eoin Colfer

Eoin Colfer is an Irish writer who was born in 1965 in Wexford, Ireland.

Colfer has written many teenage fiction series. Some of the books from these series’ are Half Moon Investigations, Legend of Captain Crow's Teeth, and The Supernaturalist. Besides this, Colfer has written the sixth installment of The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy, called And Another Thing... The series was originally written by Douglas Adams, but after his death, Colfer was requested by Adams’ wife to write the last book of the series.

Colfer first got noticed in 2001 when he published the first Artemis Fowl book. Since then, he has written a number of books and is a New York Times bestselling author for teenage and kids’ fiction. Although he has written several books, Colfer is most popularly known for his Artemis Fowl Series, has been compared to J.K Rowling on many accounts. The author presently lives in his hometown, Wexford, Ireland with his wife, Jackie. They have two children named Sean and Finn.

Title: Artemis Fowl: Opal Deception
Author: ওয়েন কোলফার
Summary:
The evil pixie Opal Koboi has spent the last year in a self-induced coma, plotting her revenge on all those who foiled her attempt to destroy the LEPrecon fairy police. And Artemis Fowl is at the top of her list.
            After his last run-in with the fairies, Artemis had his mind wiped of his memories of the world belowground. But they have not forgotten about him. Once again, he must stop the human and fairy worlds from colliding – only this time, Artemis faces an enemy who may have finally outsmarted him.

Title: Artemis fowl : The Atlantis Complex
Author: ওয়েন কোলফার
Summary:
Criminal mastermind Artemis Fowl has summoned an elite group of high-tech fairies to Iceland. He wants to present his invention to save the world from global warming. But something terrible has happened to him.

Artemis Fowl has become nice.

The fairies diagnose Atlantis Complex (aka multiple-personality disorder) – dabbling in magic has damaged Artemis's mind. And now the subterranean city of Atlantis is under attack from vicious robots and nice Artemis is no use to anyone
